content: Both traditional hand washing and using hand sanitizer are effective methods of hand hygiene against harmful bacteria. However, traditional hand washing with soap and water is considered more effective in removing dirt, grime, and certain types of harmful bacteria that may not be effectively eliminated by hand sanitizer. Hand sanitizer is useful when soap and water are not readily available, and it can effectively eliminate most types of harmful bacteria on the hands. Therefore, it is recommended to use both methods of hand hygiene to ensure optimal protection against harmful bacteria.
